page.title: 16The Mill Mound
page.content: In the field near Church Hill there is a mound. Mrs Weatherby told us about it and gave us permission to go and see it as it is on their property. It is just a mound in the middle of the field with some very ancient yew trees growing on it. It has been classified as an ancient monument so no one can destroy it. The rumours in the village are that Roman soldiers are buried in the mound but Mrs Weatherby told us that an archaelogist worked on the mound about twenty years ago but found nothing. Twelve of us went to see the mound and most of us did not know about this ancient monument in the village untill we visited it. Superstitous people in the village believe that if you dig into the mound you will have bad luck.
